utterance.content: Ballistics report came back negative. No unusual fibers or fingerprints in the apartment or backyard either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, talk to the neighbours again. Find out if any of them remember seeing him with a woman Thursday night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Dude...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm wondering why a man as wealthy as Wilder would choose a cheap motel in Jersey to have a tryst.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe there's more going on than just a tryst.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His name is Damian Wilder.

utterance.speaker: MAN AT RECEPTION
utterance.content: Never seen him before. But I wasn't on duty. Benny was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I'd like to talk with Benny.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: So would I. He didn't show up for work today, which is why I'm here covering on my day off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have contact info for him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The corner room, second floor, who stayed in there last Thursday?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Oh, let's see. Paid cash up front, four nights. Name was... Scarlett O'Hara.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scarlett O'Hara?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She's... a fictional character.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It's that kind of place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks. Benny's roommate said that he came home from his shift, packed a bag and left in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it just me, or is the timing a little suspicious?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm gonna put a want out for him in the system. He's gotta be there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the clerk said our mystery woman rented the room for four nights. Wilder's calendar was pretty packed the whole time. It's hard to figure him getting back out there to see her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did she rent it for that long? What was going on out there?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Breaking news. Guess what just turned up for sale online? A first edition Catcher in the Rye and a signed For Whom the Bell Tolls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it those are both items in Wilder's collection.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Bingo. The site belonged to a rare book dealer. Goes by the name of Lukas Canby. He's got a jacket for dealing in stolen property and last month, he was arrested for assaulting another book dealer at an auction that didn't go his way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he's got a history of violence and possession of our vic's property.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: You care to sit in while I get him to confess to Wilder's murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don't mind if I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You care to sit in while I get him to confess to Wilder's murder?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: $50,000 worth of books goes missing from a dead man's apartment, turns up in your possession.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can see how that's a problem, can't you, Lukas?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to explain what happened?

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: But you'll never believe me.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Try us.

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: I bought 'em from some guy in the park.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: In the park?

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: Near the 76th Street entrance. This homeless looking guy had 'em laid out on a blanket. Didn't have a clue what they were worth. Gave him 100 bucks for the whole lot. Man, was I feeling lucky that day.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, that's how I felt when I followed that leprechaun...

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: to his pot of gold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: I didn't steal those books, and I most certainly didn't kill anybody.

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: It was this homeless guy. Had to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? You expect us to believe that he broke in to Wilder's apartment, killed him for $50,000 worth of books just to sell it to you for 100 bucks?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Doesn't add up, pal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you Sunday night?

utterance.speaker: LUKAS
utterance.content: Home... alone.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn't worry. You won't be alone in your cell. Rikers is overcrowded these days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's have C.S.U. Take samples from Lukas' apartment and office, run them against what they recovered.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Might be something that puts them at the crime scene, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In the meantime, we should check on his story about the homeless guy, just in case.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: It's a nice day to be out in the park. Can I buy you a hot dog?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They're supposed to be finding that homeless guy. I don't know how they're gonna do that when all they can do is make goo-goo eyes at each other.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett's a good cop. She can canvass and make goo-goo eyes at the same time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should call the motel, see if Benny's turned up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just called ten minutes ago. Besides, chances are, this book guy that Demming's got in the lockup did it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, don't say that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? Oooooh. You want to be the one to crack it, not Demming, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the guy is not even Homicide. Doesn't that bug you just a little?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe a little. But that's not why it bugs you, is it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Just heard back from the phone company. Only one call came into the motel room during the four days that it was rented to Scarlett O'Hara.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, let me guess. Rhett Butler, right? Rhett Butler? See what I did there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Call lasted two minutes. Came in around the same time that Wilder's ex said he went up to the room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the only one who would've known Wilder was there would've been the woman planning to meet him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she called to say she was running late.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well, here's the money part... The call came... from Wilder's company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was having an affair with someone from work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but unfortunately, the way that they route the calls, we were only able to narrow it down to an extension on the third floor of his building.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, and we can rule out all the men, since we know Scarlett was a woman.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and most likely, it was the woman that Wilder was fighting with at his apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's gotta be a way we can figure out who it was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We could do a sound lineup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sound lineup?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we bring in the guy who overheard the argument, have him listen to voice samples from all the women on the third floor, see if he recognizes any of 'em.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can do that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. We don't even need to bring any of the women in. We can patch into the voice mail system, pull samples from there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You guys, if this works, I'll keep you both in shave cream for a year.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You found him?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Take a seat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we got lucky. Apparently, Marty the junkie here is a permanent fixture in that part of the park. He was panhandling right about where Lukas said he bought books.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Which Marty's already admitted to selling to him for 100 bucks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has he admitted to breaking into Wilder's apartment?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, that's where things get interesting. His alibi for the break-in is solid. He picked up a few extra bucks at a soup kitchen, cleaning up after hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Claims he found the books in a garbage can. Says he saw somebody dumping them there a couple hours after our murder.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Which, pretty good bet, that is our killer. I'm gonna sit him down with a sketch artist now. Come on, Marty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any leads on our mystery woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, yes.

utterance.speaker: SAMPLE ON THE COMPUTER
utterance.content: Hey, you've reached Katie Marks. I'm not at my desk right now. Leave a message, and I'll get back to you as soon as I can.

utterance.speaker: LANCE
utterance.content: That's not her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. I will cue to the next one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So did Marty the junkie say he got a good look at who it was that tossed the books?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pretty good, yeah. Hopefully, one of these two leads will pan out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, hopefully.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm gonna go and check on that sketch.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN ON COMPUTER
utterance.content: Leave a message or try my cell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, how about this one?

utterance.speaker: VOICE ON COMPUTER
utterance.content: Hi, this is Jane. I'm away from my desk, please leave a message.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No dice, huh?

utterance.speaker: VOICE ON COMPUTER
utterance.content: You've reached Sophie. I can't take your call right now so leave your name and number and I'll get back to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Next one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only three more.

utterance.speaker: WOMANS VOICE ON COMPUTER
utterance.content: Hi, this is Lisa Jenkins. If you've reached this, that means I'm out of the office. Please leave a message.

utterance.speaker: LANCE
utterance.content: That's her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lisa Jenkins? That's the woman we interviewed. You sure?

utterance.speaker: LANCE
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm positive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Remember our deal, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was Lisa Jenkins. Wilder was fighting with Lisa...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's a pretty solid likeness.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Oh, it's Marty's sketch of the man he saw tossing the books... Wilder's cousin--Blake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we have a witness who says that he heard Lisa Jenkins in a knock-down-drag-out with Wilder, and another one says that he saw Wilder's cousin dumping his books. But what we don't have from either suspect is motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy. Lisa's affair with Wilder went south. They could no longer work together side by side, and she didn't want to have to quit her job. Detective Demming?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Oh, you know, it could be anything. I don't know. Maybe Blake didn't like the fact that Wilder grew up to be more successful than him. You bet he was sick of getting beat at golf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Golf, really?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: To be honest with you, I'm not that concerned about a motive right now. I've got an eyewitness that saw him tossing his cousin's prize book collection the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have a witness, too.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: That heard Wilder fight with someone three days ago. It doesn't mean anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least I have a motive.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, but can't put your suspect at the scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys. This isn't a competition. We've got two good suspects. Seems to me that we should bring them in and see what they say.

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Damian and I had an argument at his apartment on Thursday night, but I was not having an affair with him, and I never went to New Jersey to meet him in any motel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our witness said that he heard things being thrown, and that Wilder said something about having a gun to his head.

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: No, no. He was talking about the protestors. You see, Damian was unhappy because it was taking so long for us to find a new manufacturer. And as head production, he felt that was on me. I didn't think it was fair, and... things got a little heated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you tell us where you were Sunday night?

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: I was out for dinner with some friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After dinner?

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: Can you be a little more specific?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I can be a lot more specific. Uh, let's say between 10:34 and 10:52.

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: I was home... alone. Though I did step out at some point. My neighborhood has alternate side of the street parking, and I had to move my car, find a different space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did anyone see you?

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: Not that I know of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was that?

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: Uh... 10:15 maybe?

utterance.speaker: CASLTE
utterance.content: You live, what, ten blocks down Lex from where Wilder lived? At that hour, that drive would take you two minutes.

utterance.speaker: LISA
utterance.content: I suppose. I've never really timed it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see how squirrelly she got when you asked her where she was Sunday night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll have Esposito talk to her doorman. There might be security cam footage that might nail down how long she was gone from her apartment. Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I sit in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WILDER
utterance.content: I can't believe that you guys are dragging me down here on the word of some bum, and then accusing me of murdering my own cousin.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, believe me. We'd like nothing more than to be able to rule you out. So tell me again. You said you were meeting some friends for a drink Sunday night?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: Yeah, a-at McDugan's, after 11:00.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's about a block away from your cousin's place.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: And you say you were at home until you went out to meet your friends?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Are you sure about that? Because I'm gonna talk to your doorman.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: I-I don't have one.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, I'm gonna talk to your neighbors. I'm gonna check your credit card receipts. If you weren't home when you say you were, I am gonna find out about it.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: All right, all right, fine. I didn't go straight to the bar. I went to a newsstand. I bought some cigarettes, all right? My friends think that I quit, but every once in a while, I get a craving that I can't put off. So I went to the ATM, I got some cash. I bought a pack, smoked a few, threw the rest away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE
utterance.content: I don't remember.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, your ATM will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can take a seat.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Excuse us.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, at a newsstand, corner of 32nd and Lex? Yeah, yeah, go ahead. I'll hold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, there she is, leaving her building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the time stamp says 10:18.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which would give her plenty of time to jump in her car and get down to Wilder's place by 10:34.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we know that the killer left the crime scene at 10:52. So the question is, when did she get back?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Yeah, got it. Thanks. So the bank confirmed Blake's ATM withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: 10:39 P.M. Right smack in the middle of our timeline.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that means it wasn't him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here she is coming home. Let me just rewind a little bit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what does the time stamp say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's inside our timeline. That's impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It wasn't her either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was so sure.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, guys? It's late. Why don't we just call it a night? Night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey there.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Chet had one of his ghastly political functions. I needed my stationery. I'm writing a note to Madge to tell her how brilliant her performance was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, don't do that.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, she's your rival. You should be crushing her, not giving her comfort.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. No. Give Madge my best.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, good. You're just in time. Looks like we caught a break on our Scarlett O'Hara.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You found her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Found the next best thing-- the clerk who checked her in to the motel. Police picked him up in Atlantic City for charges of disorderly conduct. Morning, sunshine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why'd you leave town in such a hurry, Benny?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: I was feeling lucky. Wanted to get to the craps table fast as I could.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you have a good time down there, Benny?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Dude. I appreciate you guys interjecting with the police down there on my behest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we wanted to talk with you.

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Well, I'm happy to help. One favor, though. Could you not talk so loud? My head is killing me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last Thursday, you were on duty when a Scarlett O'Hara checked in.

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I think I remember.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did she look like?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: I woulda done her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Um... she was small for her size.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Yeah. That guy's a total nut bar. Last week--think it was Thursday, matter of fact-- he pulls into the motel in a fancy foreign job. He goes straight up to the corner room on the second floor. Couple minutes later, he charges down, starts asking me all the same questions you were asking me. Who rented the room, what did she look like?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn't know?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: That's what I said. I told him, if he had to ask me whose room it was, he shouldn't be going in there in the first place. He stomped off, got in his car. He left. Boom! Never saw him again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you won't either. He was murdered Sunday night.

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: With that kinda attitude, this is not surprising. Well, if I've answered all your queries to your satisfaction, am I free to go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just one more query if you don't mind. According to the Atlantic City police, you were arrested in the diamond lounge of a strip club for trying to set a rodeo clown on fire.

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: That was a misunderstanding and--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My question is, how does a $9-an-hour hotel clerk pay for a $500-an-hour V.I.P. Lounge?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: I won at craps. Like I said, I was feeling lucky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. That's a Damian Wilder bag.

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's the guy who was killed. Where'd you get that?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Um...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where'd you get it, Benny?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Um, please, just not so loud.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you get it?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: I found it in the room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Scarlett O'Hara's room?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: After checkout on the fourth day, I went up there on account of she never returned the key. The room was like nobody'd even been there. The bed was made, towels were on the rack. I gave it a quick once-over, figured I'd tell housekeeping not to bother going in. I found the bag under the bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was in it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was in it?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: Aah! There was money... lots of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How much?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: 75 grand. There.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you blow it all, Benny?

utterance.speaker: BENNY
utterance.content: It was the best three days of my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A duffel bag full of cash an anonymous hotel room and an angry Wilder-- all of that adds up to only one thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blackmail.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: It's the only scenario that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the blackmailer contacts Wilder with instructions to meet at the motel at a certain time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably to show him proof of whatever it is she has against him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But she doesn't want him to know who she is or that she works at his company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
